I have written in great haste, in great earnestness, for I feel that the case demands a speedy and severe remedy. Be assured that God will not use individuals who have traveled much in darkness to direct and teach His children. These are perilous times. God works through those who have walked carefully and in humility before Him; those who have been true; those who have moved understandingly and in His fear.--Letter 2, 1863, pp. 1,2,4. (To a leading worker, June 20, 1863.) 

White Estate Washington, D. C. February 4, 1982
